81.heading: Lady Sin.
81.title: El Cazador.
81.author: [No author]
notes: Published no. 1 (Oct. 2003) - no. 6 (June 2004).

Summary (from OCLC): The ship carrying Spanish noblewoman Donessa Cinzia Elena Marie Esperanza Diego-Luis Hidalgo is attacked by pirate captain Blackjack Tom; surviving the attack, she swears to hunt down Tom and rescue his prisoners; re-naming her ship El Cazador ("The Hunter") she becomes a pirate herself, dubbed "Lady Sin" by her crew.

82.heading: Lady Sin.
82.title: El Cazador
82.author: by Chuck Dixon ; drawings by Steve Epting.
notes: Originally published as issues 1-6 of the comic book series El Cazador from Oct. 2003 to June 2004.

Summary (from OCLC): When a crew of pirates boards the galleon she was traveling on, killing the crew and abducting her family for ransom, a young Spanish woman adopts the name Lady Sin and sets off on a career of piracy and revenge.

109.title: LadyBlack
109.author: Geri
notes: "Résumé: Enquêtant sur la mystérieuse disparation du fils du milliardaire américan Mauro Conti, Lady Black gagne le coeur de Harlem pour rencontrer 'Mamy,' la propriétaire du Popcorn Bar, qui, selon l'officier de police Klausky, pourra utilement la tuyauter."
"A suivre."

110.title: LadyBlack
110.author: Geri
notes: "Résumé: Retour de son enquête au 'Popcorn Bar,' en plein coeur de Harlem, Lady Black est interceptée par des malfrats. Mais, chance pour elle, ceux-ci, trop curieux, ont ouvert le sac contenant le redoutable cobra cracheur."
"A suivre."

111.title: LadyBlack
111.author: Geri
notes: "Résumé: Son enquête a conduit Lady Black chez Charley, le gérant de la pension 'Blue Blues,' où peut-être se terre le fils de Mauro Conti. Mais l'enfant est-il vraiment 'le fils' du milliardaire, et l'étrange femme noire qu'elle a rencontrée, la mère du fugueur, comme elle le prétend?"
"A suivre."

112.title: LadyBlack
112.author: Geri
notes: "Résumé: Poursuivie par la mystérieuse femme noire aux lunettes, qui vient de 'liquider' Charley, Lady Black découvre, enfin, la retraite de l'enfant du milliardaire Mauro Conti qu'elle avait charg de retrouver."
"A suivre."

126.series: South Africa) The Siege of Ladysmith
notes: A picture narrative of the siege, which took place at Ladysmith, South Africa, during the Anglo-Boer War of 1899-1902.
"This work, first published in London in 1900 as The Leaguer of Ladysmith, is re-published in a reduced format, to mark the centenary of the famous siege."

142.heading: Laestadius, L. I.
142.title: My Fair Matey
142.author: story and illustration by Jaime ; edited by L
notes: Cantaloupe, 2005.

"19th century life can be challenging for dirty, unrefined, orphan dealing, former transgender pirates. It's no wonder then that Florian Smelton is trying to make a career change and improve his lot in life. A fateful encounter with a wealthy young heiress sets the stage for both progress and peril in a tale only Jaime's pen could tell"
